Sentencas: The production of synthetic natural gas (SNG) from syngas derived through waste gasification is an attractive option for converting waste into useful fuel.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analyses of synthetic natural gas production via municipal solid waste gasification, high-temperature water electrolysis and methanation

Sentencas: However, the carbon conversion ratio of traditional SNG production is usually below 50% due to the limited amount of H-2, while the excess CO2 needs to be removed.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analyses of synthetic natural gas production via municipal solid waste gasification, high-temperature water electrolysis and methanation

Sentencas: To realize a higher utilization of carbon, a novel SNG production system combining a municipal solid waste (MSW) gasifier, a solid oxide electrolyzer cell (SOEC) and a methanation unit is proposed and analyzed by thermodynamic modeling using ASPEN Plus (R).
Titulo: Thermodynamic analyses of synthetic natural gas production via municipal solid waste gasification, high-temperature water electrolysis and methanation

Sentencas: Comparison is made with a similar system without the SOEC unit.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analyses of synthetic natural gas production via municipal solid waste gasification, high-temperature water electrolysis and methanation

Sentencas: The SOEC unit is used to electrolyze water into H-2 required for higher CH4 production, thus eliminating the need of CO (2) removal.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analyses of synthetic natural gas production via municipal solid waste gasification, high-temperature water electrolysis and methanation

Sentencas: Theoretical calculations show that the integration between SOEC with the gasifier produces H,-rich (greater than18 vol% H-2) SNG without CO or CO2, allowing direct use of existing town-gas pipelines for easy transportation.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analyses of synthetic natural gas production via municipal solid waste gasification, high-temperature water electrolysis and methanation

Sentencas: With an equivalence air ratio of 0.3 for the gasification process, the carbon conversion ratio can achieve 98% with an efficiency of 67% when the ratio of H2O supplied to the SOEC unit to the carbon in the MSW reaches 2.75.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analyses of synthetic natural gas production via municipal solid waste gasification, high-temperature water electrolysis and methanation

Sentencas: In comparison, the system without SOEC unit can only achieve a carbon conversion ratio of 44% with an efficiency of 78%.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analyses of synthetic natural gas production via municipal solid waste gasification, high-temperature water electrolysis and methanation

Sentencas: Parameter selection of the proposed system in practical implementation is discussed considering the trade-off between the carbon conversion ratio and the efficiency.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analyses of synthetic natural gas production via municipal solid waste gasification, high-temperature water electrolysis and methanation

Sentencas: At the end, preliminary economic analysis also shows that the proposed system is financially attractive.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analyses of synthetic natural gas production via municipal solid waste gasification, high-temperature water electrolysis and methanation
